title: Layout of Rust's u128 and i128 changed
dot:
digraph RustAlignment{rankdir=TB;node[shape=box];subgraph cluster_intro{label="Introduction";intro[label="Rust's alignment inconsistency with C
regarding 128-bit integers
on x86-32/x86-64"];}subgraph cluster_user_concerns{label="User  Concerns";concern1[label="1. Assuming alignment of `i128`/`u128`"];concern2[label="2. Ignoring `improper_ctypes*` lints"];user[label="Users need to be aware of changes
if they fall into these categories"];user->concern1;user->concern2;}subgraph cluster_effects{label="Effects of Changes";effect1[label="Runtime performance increases"];effect2[label="Possible additional memory use"];effects[label="Effects of alignment fix"];effects->effect1;effects->effect2;}subgraph cluster_background{label="Background on Data Types";size[label="Size: Space in memory"];alignment[label="Alignment: Allowed addresses for placement"];intrinsic[label="Types have intrinsic values: Size & Alignment"];intrinsic->size;intrinsic->alignment;}subgraph cluster_incorrect_alignment{label="Incorrect Alignment Problem";rust_alignment[label="Rust's `i128` alignment = 8"];c_alignment[label="C's `__int128` alignment = 16"];alignment_problem[label="Mismatch causes sharing issues"];rust_alignment->alignment_problem;c_alignment->alignment_problem;}subgraph cluster_calling_convention{label="Calling Convention Problem";llvm_issue[label="LLVM does not handle 128-bit arguments correctly"];calling_convention[label="ABI specifies 128-bit types must align on 16-byte boundary"];llvm_issue->calling_convention;}subgraph cluster_solutions{label="Solutions";patch1[label="Patch by Simonas Kazlauskas (2017)"];patch2[label="Manual adjustment for alignment by Clang"];final_patch[label="Final fix implemented in LLVM 18"];patch1->patch2;patch2->final_patch;}subgraph cluster_compatibility{label="Compatibility Matrix";compatibility1[label="Rust ≥ 1.78 + LLVM 18 <-> GCC: Fully compatible"];compatibility2[label="Rust ≥ 1.77 + LLVM < 18 <-> GCC: Storage compatible, calling bug"];compatibility3[label="Rust < 1.77 <-> GCC: Incompatible"];compatibility1->compatibility2;compatibility2->compatibility3;}intro->user;intro->effects;intro->background;background->incorrect_alignment;background->calling_convention;incorrect_alignment->solutions;calling_convention->solutions;solutions->compatibility;}
